Problem:
Consider a system defined by the function \\( z(x, t) = xe^{At} \\), where A is a constant scalar. We evaluate the results of incorporating an operational matrix, \\( P(t) = e^{Bt} \\), where B is also a constant scalar, impacting the function over time t.

Given the value of \\( z(x, T) \\) as \\( xe^{AT} \\), can we definitively determine whether the transformation \\( P(t) \\) was applied at \\( t = 0 \\)?
Explanation: Since the transformation \\( P(0) \\) equals the identity matrix, observing the value of \\( z(x, T) \\) as \\( xe^{AT} \\) does not provide information about whether \\( P(t) \\) was initially applied. The resulting state at T would be the same either way.
